title: US teacher put on leave after allegedly calling Palestinian child an extremist
Avid photographers were trying for an 'apocalyptic" shot.' They captured history instead.
DOJ shake-up: Donald Trump fires dozens of justice department employees involved in his prosecutions
description: Acting attorney general James McHenry has dismissed over a dozen prosecutors involved in the investigations against President Trump, citing concerns about their loyalty to the president's agenda. This move is part of Trump's broader efforts to centralize control over the justice department, raising legal and ethical questions about the administration's approach.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Indian-origin Canadian MP Chandra Arya 'not permitted' to run for leadership race
description: Canadian MP Chandra Arya has been barred from the Liberal Party's leadership contest. He was informed by the party about his disqualification. Arya's campaign included eliminating the monarchy and addressing issues with strained Canada-India relations. His disqualification raises concerns about the leadership race transparency. While Arya mulls his next steps, six contenders remain in the race.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Rwandan-backed rebels M23 claim capture of eastern DRC city Goma
description: Fighters enter city on border with Rwanda after lightning advance, raising risk of broader regional warFighters from the Democratic Republic of the Congo’s Rwanda-backed M23 rebel group claim to have taken the eastern city of Goma after a lightning advance in recent weeks that has forced thousands from their homes and risked reigniting a broader regional war.The M23 spokesperson Lawrence Kanyuka said on X: “We urge all residents of Goma to remain calm. The liberation of the city has been successfully carried out and the situation is under control.” Continue reading...
author: Carlos Mureithi in Nairobi

title: France seeks UN resolution naming Rwanda as backer of M23 rebels in DRC
description: M23’s lightning advance into east DRC being supported by up to 4,000 Rwandan troops, say UN officialsFrance is seeking western support for a UN security council resolution that names Rwanda as being behind the M23 rebel group attacks inside the Democratic Republic of the Congo, including the surprise weekend seizure of parts of Goma, the largest city in eastern DRC.UN officials said as many as 4,000 Rwandan troops were escorting the M23 rebels. The UN secretary general, António Guterres, on Sunday called on “the Rwandan defence forces to stop supporting the M23 and to withdraw from the territory of the DRC”. It was his clearest statement of Rwandan responsibility for much of the violence. Continue reading...
author: Patrick Wintour Diplomatic editor

title: Nvidia shares sink as Chinese AI app spooks markets
description: Share prices in US and European firms fall as the Chinese technology threatens to disrupt the AI industry.

title: Survivors of Auschwitz deliver warning from history as memories die out
description: World leaders rubbed shoulders with 56 survivors of Hitler's death camp as they marked 80 years since its liberation.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Hamas Says 300,000 Displaced Palestinians Return To North Gaza
description: Masses of displaced Palestinians streamed into the north of war-ravaged Gaza on Monday after Israel and Hamas reached a deal for the release of another six hostages.

title: Trump To Sign Order To Build Israeli-Style 'Iron Dome' Missile Shield
description: President Donald Trump said Monday he would sign an executive order to start building an "Iron Dome" air defense system for the United States, like the one that Israel has used to intercept thousands of rockets.

title: In Carts and on Foot, Gazans Make the Long Trek Home
description: Tens of thousands of Palestinians began arriving in northern Gaza, months after Israel ordered them out. The Israel-Hamas cease-fire was holding after faltering over the weekend.
author: The New York Times

title: Cease-Fires in Gaza and Lebanon Will Most Likely Hold for Now, Analysts Say
description: Bloodshed over the weekend highlighted the brittleness of the cease-fires in both places. Still, Israel, Hamas and Hezbollah each have reasons to postpone a new escalation, at least for a few weeks.
author: Patrick Kingsley

title: Nvidia sheds almost $600 billion in market cap, biggest one-day loss in U.S. history
description: Nvidia shares plunged 17% on Monday, resulting in a market cap loss of close to $600 billion, the biggest drop ever for a U.S. company.

title: DeepSeek hit with large-scale cyberattack, says it's limiting registrations
description: DeepSeek on Monday said it would temporarily limit user registrations "due to large-scale malicious attacks" on its services.

description: Justice Department moves to fire at least 12 officials who investigated Trump  NPRTrump DOJ Fires Prosecutors Who Worked on Jack Smith Investigations  National ReviewTrump administration fires DOJ officials who worked on criminal investigations of the president  NBC NewsTrump Justice Department says it has fired employees involved in prosecutions of the president  The Associated PressTrump administration fires Justice Dept. lawyers who brought criminal cases against him  CBC News

title: Hegseth, Trump’s Pentagon ‘disrupter,’ vows swift action
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth signaled Trump would sign executive orders intended to roll back diversity initiatives and shake up the military.
author: Missy Ryan, Dan Lamothe, John Hudson

title: What is DeepSeek, the Chinese AI app challenging OpenAI and Silicon Valley?
description: Everything you need to know about DeepSeek, the Chinese AI chatbot app shaking up Silicon Valley.
author: Gerrit De Vynck, Heather Kelly, Annabelle Timsit
